description: This delicious vegetable lasagna is a hearty, flavor-packed recipe that is ideal for keeping on hand to impress guests or preparing a veg-packed dinner.
ingredients: [{"name": "zucchini", "units": null, "amount": 1}, {"name": "eggplant", "units": null, "amount": 1}, {"name": "red bell peppers", "units": null, "amount": 2}, {"name": "mushrooms", "units": "g", "amount": 100}, {"name": "spinach", "units": "g", "amount": 200}, {"name": "garlic cloves", "units": null, "amount": 4}, {"name": "olive oil", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 2}, {"name": "Italian seasoning", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "salt", "units": null, "amount": null}, {"name": "pepper", "units": null, "amount": null}, {"name": "white onion", "units": null, "amount": 1}, {"name": "celery stick", "units": null, "amount": 1}, {"name": "carrot", "units": null, "amount": 1}, {"name": "passata with basil", "units": "g", "amount": 1000}, {"name": "red pepper flakes", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 0.5}, {"name": "basil", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "water", "units": "ml", "amount": 100}, {"name": "butter", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 2}, {"name": "plain flour", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 2}, {"name": "milk", "units": "ml", "amount": 500}, {"name": "grated cheddar cheese", "units": "g", "amount": 100}, {"name": "shredded mozzarella cheese", "units": "g", "amount": 50}, {"name": "lasagna sheets", "units": "sheets", "amount": 6}]
instructions: 1) Roast the vegetables: Dice your zucchini, eggplant, peppers, and mushrooms into evenly-sized cubes. Toss with olive oil, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper. Roast at 220C (428F) for 30 minutes, then add the minced garlic and roast 10 minutes more. Stir in spinach at the end. 2) Make the Sauces: For the tomato sauce, sauté onion, carrot, and celery in oil for 5-6 minutes, then add the passata, herbs, red pepper flakes, and water. Simmer for at least 30 minutes until thick. For the béchamel, melt butter, whisk in flour, then slowly whisk in milk until smooth. Cook until thickened, then stir in cheese and black pepper. 3) Assemble the Lasagna: Spread a thin layer of the tomato sauce over the bottom of your baking dish. Add the lasagna noodles, then a layer of béchamel, roasted vegetables, cheese, and tomato sauce again. Repeat until finished with the noodles, then sauce, béchamel, and cheese on top. 4) Cook your Lasagna: Bake at 200C (400F) for 35-40 minutes until golden and bubbling. Let sit for 10-15 minutes before slicing.
notes: Aim to roast your vegetables until they're lightly caramelized. Letting the lasagna rest is non-negotiable for clean slices. Store leftovers in an airtight container for up to 4 days.
